newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks ends lower in consolidation.
newsitem.headline: French stocks ends lower in consolidation.

text.p: French shares finished with losses with the market consolidating after recent strong gains, traders said. The market largely shrugged off a weaker-than-expected report from the U.S. National Association of Purchasing Managers.
Stocks in the luxury goods sector rose, while oils and Air Liquide declined.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index ended down 9.60 points or 0.45 percent at 2,123.21, while the CAC-40 futures contract was down at 2,128 from 2,134 on Monday's close.
Volume was a solid 4.55 billion francs.

* In the luxury sector LVMH firms 0.09 percent to 1,122 francs, Dior 1.32 percent to 612, and Hermes 3.96 to 1,259. All benefit from dollar appreciation and catch-up effect after recent underperformance
* Sanofi gains 3.02 percent to 436 francs, boosted by registration of the Irbesartan hypertension drug, which is expected to generate between $500 million-$1 billion in sales when it is marketed
* Accor gains 2.82 percent to 656 francs on newspaper reports a Cie Generale des Eaux executive, Jean-Marc Espalioux, could be named as the next chairman.
* Air Liquide eases 1.88 percent to 785 francs onthe back of its first-half results. Dupont-Denant cut its recommendation.
